author: Ginger Stevenson
title: Can you take pictures inside Sacré Coeur?
text:
Can you take pictures inside Sacré Coeur?
According to the information available, Sacré Coeur has a strict no-photo policy inside the basilica. Visitors are not allowed to take any pictures, and there are attendants at the entrance who will scold you if you try to take photos.
Is the panoramic view of Sacré Coeur worth it?
Yes, the panoramic view of Sacré Coeur is definitely worth it. The basilica’s dome is the highest point in Paris after the Eiffel Tower, and climbing to the top will give you wonderful panoramic views across the heart of Paris.
Can I wear shorts in Sacré Coeur?
While there is no specific dress code to enter Sacré Coeur, visitors are asked to wear “decent clothing.” This usually means that shoulders need to be covered, hats must be removed, and shorts, dresses, and skirts should be below the knees.
How long do you spend in Sacré Coeur?
It takes approximately 45 minutes to an hour to visit the Dome and the Crypt of Sacré Coeur. To reach the unique viewpoint over Paris, you will have to climb 300 steps.
Is it worth going to Sacré Coeur at night?
Yes, it is worth going to Sacré Coeur at night. The white-domed church is illuminated and is a spectacular sight. You can experience breathtaking views of the city and enjoy the pleasures of Paris at night.

Is Montmartre safe in the evening?
Montmartre is generally considered a safe neighborhood, especially during the day. However, it is recommended to be cautious and aware of your surroundings, particularly in the evening. Down the hill from Sacré Coeur is Pigalle, which is known as the Red-Light district and can be more lively and crowded.
What is the best time to visit Sacre Coeur?
Early afternoon is a good time for taking photos of the Basilica. If you plan to visit the artist’s square, middle afternoon to evening is best, as artists tend to start their day late. It is also recommended to check the official website for opening times and any special events or closures.
Is there a dress code for Sacre Coeur?
There is no specific dress code enforced for Sacre Coeur. However, as it is an active place of worship, visitors are advised to dress respectfully. It is recommended to wear decent clothing, keep shoulders covered, remove hats, and ensure that shorts, dresses, and skirts are below the knees.
What is inside Sacre Coeur?
Inside Sacre Coeur, you will find a Roman-Byzantine style basilica with a recognizable white color. The ceiling is decorated with the largest mosaic in France, covering an area of approximately 480 m². The crypt is also worth a visit.
What is so special about Sacre Coeur?
Sacre Coeur is known for its unique features, including its remarkable whiteness. It was built with a special stone that exudes calcite when wet, giving the facade a sparkling white appearance. The central dome, 83 meters high, is topped by a skylight formed by a colonnade. The apse ceiling is decorated with the largest mosaic in France, representing the Sacred Heart of Jesus glorified by the Catholic Church and France.
Are there toilets in Sacré-Coeur?
Yes, there are toilets available in Sacré-Coeur. However, official information regarding their locations and accessibility is not specified.
Why was Sacré-Coeur controversial?
Sacré-Coeur was controversial during its construction due to the political and social climate of the time. The republicans welcomed the Eiffel Tower but despised Sacré-Coeur, associating its construction with the massacre of the Communards. There was a clash between the two sides on every aspect of public life, and architecture was no exception.
Can you bring bags into Sacré-Coeur?
There are no specific guidelines mentioned regarding visiting Sacré-Coeur with bags. However, it is recommended to travel light as the access to the basilica is via cobblestone streets or a large staircase, and it may be difficult to navigate with bulky bags.
Can you see Eiffel Tower from Sacré-Coeur?
Yes, from the top of the Montmartre hill, Sacré-Coeur Basilica offers a breathtaking view of Paris, including the Eiffel Tower. You can clearly see the iconic structure stretching high into the Parisian sky.
Can you see sunset from Sacré-Coeur?
Visiting Sacré-Coeur before sunset allows you to enjoy the magnificent dusky views. The best time to visit is approximately an hour before sunset when the sun is low enough to cast a gentle glow but still high enough for the rays to bounce off the golden dome.
Why is Sacré-Coeur so white?
The unique whiteness of Sacré-Coeur is due to the special stone used in its construction. When wet, this stone exudes calcite, giving the facade a sparkling white appearance on rainy days.
Can you go in the Dome of Sacré-Coeur?
Yes, you can visit the Dome of Sacré-Coeur. However, access to the Crypt is currently closed for security reasons. The entrance to the Dome is located outside the Basilica, and there are charges for visiting. Note that it involves climbing 300 steps to reach the Dome, as there are no lifts available.
Is Sacré-Coeur lit up at night?
Yes, Sacré-Coeur is lit up at night, providing a beautiful illumination to the white-domed church. The lighting highlights the grandeur of the building, and it offers exceptional panoramic views of the city when visited at night.
What is the bracelet trick at Sacré-Coeur?
The bracelet trick is a scam frequently encountered near Sacré-Coeur. Scammers engage unsuspecting visitors in conversation and offer to show them a magic trick. While demonstrating the trick, they grab the victim’s wrist or fingers and encircle it with a homemade bracelet made of colored string. They then insist on payment for the bracelet.
Do you have to cover shoulders in Sacré-Coeur?
According to the available information, it is recommended to have shoulders covered when inside the Sacré-Coeur Basilica. Although there is no specific enforceable dress code, as it is an active place of worship, respect and appropriate clothing are encouraged.
Does Sacré-Coeur have an entrance fee?
No, there is no entrance fee to visit Sacré-Coeur Basilica. The basilica is open every day from 6:30 am to 10:30 pm, and entrance is free.
Is Montmartre and Sacre Coeur the same?
No, Montmartre and Sacré-Coeur are not the same. Montmartre is a neighborhood in Paris, and Sacré-Coeur Basilica is located on the highest hill in Montmartre.
How many steps is Sacre Coeur?
To reach the top of the Dome of Sacré-Coeur, visitors need to climb 300 steps. This climb will reward them with a breathtaking view of Paris, including landmarks like La Défense, the Eiffel Tower, and more.
What are two interesting facts about Sacre Coeur?
Two interesting facts about Sacré Coeur are that it is self-cleaning and that it was a place of worship even before the church was built. The unique construction material of the basilica causes it to shine white when wet. Additionally, the hill on which Sacré Coeur stands has been a place of worship since ancient times.
